setup: You trail a lone pedestrian turning onto a quiet side street.
You spot someone counting cash outside a corner store.
execution: You close in, voice low enough for only them to hear.
You step into their path, forcing them to stop.
You demand their wallet without raising your voice.
climax: They hand over their money while glancing for help.
A light comes on in a nearby window as you grab the cash.
ambient: Rain drips steadily from a loose gutter chain.
A taxi idles nearby, turn signal clicking.

setup: You watch someone hesitate at a crosswalk, clearly lost.
You follow a man walking alone with his bag slung behind him.
execution: You cut them off with a firm step forward.
You keep your tone calm but your stance blocking their way.
climax: A siren sounds faintly in the distance.
They look at you, then down at your hand, and comply.
ambient: Steam rises from a street grate.
A cyclist weaves through the intersection without stopping.

setup: You find a house with no cars in the driveway and lights off.
You pass a quiet home where the curtains are only half-closed.
execution: You slip through the unlocked back door.
You move room to room, taking only what you can carry.
You avoid turning on any lights.
climax: A floorboard creaks loudly under your weight.
Shadows move across the wall in the next room.
ambient: A refrigerator hums steadily in the kitchen.
A wall clock ticks in the distance.

setup: You notice a back gate left open in a dimly lit yard.
You approach a side door with peeling paint and no security camera.
execution: You turn the handle slowly until it clicks open.
You walk through the hall, avoiding rugs that might hide squeaky boards.
climax: Headlights flash through the front windows.
You freeze in place, listening for footsteps.
ambient: A neighbor coughs from across the fence.
Pipes knock softly as the heater kicks on.

setup: You take up a spot on a street corner with a clear line of sight to both ends.
You wait in a quiet alley where customers know to find you.
execution: You hand off small packets in quick exchanges.
You keep transactions short and eyes scanning the street.
You nod to buyers and send them on their way.
climax: A car slows down, watching you too closely.
Your heart rate spikes, but your hands stay calm.

setup: You stand under a broken streetlight to avoid being seen clearly.
You carry your stash where a quick pat-down wouldn’t find it.
execution: You keep moving so no one stands near you too long.
You spot someone hanging back, pretending to be on the phone.
climax: A siren sounds from a few streets over.
You fold into the nearest crowd and walk away.
ambient: A bus rolls by, announcing stops to no one.
Metal shutters rattle two shops down.

setup: You set up a stall with convincing knockoffs neatly arranged.
You position yourself in a busy market where foot traffic is heavy.
execution: You talk up the quality before buyers can ask questions.
You make small talk to distract from the too-good price.
You watch for anyone lingering too long without buying.
climax: You start packing the stall quickly just in case.
A man in plain clothes starts walking straight toward you.
ambient: Music from a nearby vendor blends with the crowd noise.
Cash changes hands in a steady rhythm.

setup: You unpack bags of fake merchandise, swapping brand labels.
You work in a spot where customers come looking for bargains.
execution: You spin a backstory for each item to make it seem authentic.
You notice someone’s eyes scanning your stall instead of your products.
climax: You step away before they start asking questions.
You offer one last deal to the nearest buyer and prepare to leave.
ambient: A customer loudly haggles at the next stall.
The steady hum of generators fills the market.
